meanings.sent1: The old leaves brittled in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the once flexible plastic brittled and cracked.
meanings.sent3: The cookie brittled so much, it crumbled into a thousand pieces.
meanings.sent4: Her heart brittled with each harsh word he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The ancient parchment brittled at the slightest touch, like delicate glass.

meanings.definition: To make or cause something to become brittle or fragile.
meanings.sent1: The intense heat brittled the clay figurine.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the book out in the sun will brittle the pages over time.
meanings.sent3: The magician's spell brittled the stone into dust.
meanings.sent4: His careless handling brittled the delicate vase, shattering it into pieces.
meanings.sent5: The harsh winter weather brittled the branches of the trees, making them snap easily.
